title: Home Glass Products Showcase Website

requirements.text: Create a visually elegant visual theme for the entire site inspired by glass, light, and modern interior design — using clean whites, soft grays, and warm gold/champagne accents with a refined sans-serif typography and airy layout. Apply this theme consistently across all pages.

quotes: Create a website that show home usage glasses product

acceptanceCriteria: Color palette uses white, soft gray, and gold/champagne tones with no blue or purple
Typography is a clean, modern sans-serif
The visual style feels consistent across all pages
Layout feels spacious and premium

requirements.text: Create a homepage featuring a full-width hero section with a tagline about home glass products, a featured products section highlighting items like mirrors, windows, slider doors, and glass ornaments, and a brief brand introduction section.

quotes: show home usage glasses product like mirror , windows , slider doors or etc ornament related to glasses

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section spans full width with headline and subheading
Featured products section displays at least 4 glass product cards
Brand introduction section is visible on homepage
Page is responsive on mobile and desktop

requirements.text: Build a product catalog page with category filtering. Categories must include: Mirrors, Windows, Slider Doors, Glass Doors, Glass Ornaments/Decor, and Partition Walls. Each product card must show a product image, name, category, and short description.

quotes: mirror , windows , slider doors or etc ornament related to glasses

acceptanceCriteria: All product categories are accessible via filter tabs or sidebar
Filtering by category updates the product grid without page reload
Each card shows image, name, category label, and short description
Grid is responsive — 1 column on mobile, 2–3 on tablet, 3–4 on desktop

requirements.text: Build a product detail page that displays a larger product image, full product name, category, detailed description, dimensions/specifications fields, and a 'Request a Quote' or 'Contact Us' call-to-action button.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a product card navigates to its detail page
Detail page shows large image, full description, and specifications
A clear call-to-action button is present (e.g., 'Request a Quote')
Back navigation returns to the catalog

requirements.text: Define and store all product data in the Motoko backend. Each product record must include: id, name, category, shortDescription, fullDescription, specs (key-value pairs), and imagePath. Expose query functions to fetch all products and fetch a single product by id, as well as a function to filter products by category.

quotes: mirror , windows , slider doors or etc ornament related to glasses

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores at least 10 sample glass products across all categories
getAllProducts() returns full list of products
getProductById(id) returns a single product or null
getProductsByCategory(category) returns filtered list
All data fields (id, name, category, shortDescription, fullDescription, specs, imagePath) are present in each record

requirements.text: Implement a site-wide navigation bar with the brand logo/name 'GlassHome Studio', links to Home and Catalog pages, and a footer with a short tagline and copyright notice.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation bar is visible on all pages
Brand name is displayed in the nav
Navigation links to Home and Catalog work correctly
Footer is present on all pages with tagline and copyright text
Nav collapses gracefully on mobile (hamburger or similar)

requirements.text: Render generated product and hero images from frontend/public/assets/generated as static assets displayed on the homepage hero, product cards, and product detail pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section uses the generated hero banner image
Each product category has a representative image shown on its card
Images load from frontend/public/assets/generated without backend involvement

constraints: All product data must be stored and served from the Motoko backend actor
No external APIs, databases, or third-party services
Immutable frontend paths (hooks, main.tsx, ui components) must not be modified
